metadata.title: CVE-2022-31650 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
In SoX 14.4.2, there is a floating-point exception in lsx_aiffstartwrite inaiff.c in libsox.a.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
sox - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1').
